content.question:
For parts of the free response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

The photoelectron spectrum for an unknown element is shown above.

(a) Based on the photoelectron spectrum, identify the unknown element and write its electron configuration.

frqParts.text:
For parts of the free response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

The photoelectron spectrum for an unknown element is shown above.

(a) Based on the photoelectron spectrum, identify the unknown element and write its electron configuration.

(b) Consider the element in the periodic table that is directly to the right of the element identified in part (a). Would the <math alttext="1 s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> peak of this element appear to the left of, the right of, or in the same position as the <math alttext="1 s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> peak of the element in part (a)? Explain your reasoning.

skill.text: 4.B: Explain whether a model is consistent with chemical theories.
